result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Arseneau

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  A.L.B., with victim's residence, and minors under 18 without supervision with the exception of contact with CA & CA is no violent abusive contact.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:40 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, & def guilty but defers entry of judgment. 

COURT approves DEOJ for 1 yr with terms as outlined in written agreement - if def successfully completes DEOJ agreement, charge to be DISMISSED. 
DEOJ Review set for August 25, 2023 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
Parties stipulate to bond modification. 
COURT modifies bond condition to no unsupervised contact with minors except for contact with CA & CA is no violent/abusive contact with CA & CA. 
Adj: 10:47 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:00 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty David Casey. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information to be E-filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
PTC set for 5/19/2022 at 10:45 am with JA. 
Adj: 10:01 am
Waiver of Prelim on April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Calendar call on April 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
